ygData.subject: Re: [EverQuest] Question about other NPC's killing things.
ygData.msgSnippet: I think that Nygaardr is correct. I was killing a Calf (Mammoth) and I did 100 or so dmg and Icebear comes and hits it for like 30 and I get no exp. So I think
ygData.messageBody:
I think that Nygaardr is correct. I was killing a Calf (Mammoth) and I did
100 or so dmg and Icebear comes and hits it for like 30 and I get no exp. So
I think that Nygaardr is correct.



----- Original Message -----
From: Kris Christie <KChristie@...>
To: <EverQuest@yahoogroups.com>
Sent: Tuesday, April 17, 2001 12:21 PM
Subject: RE: [EverQuest] Question about other NPC's killing things.


> Incorrect.
>
> -----Original Message-----
> From: Nygaardr, FC3 [mailto:nygaardr@...]
> Sent: Tuesday, April 17, 2001 1:23 PM
> To: 'EverQuest@yahoogroups.com'
> Subject: RE: [EverQuest] Question about other NPC's killing things.
>
>
> Sorry that's not correct. If the mob has 10,000 hps and you do 9,999 dmg
> and the guard does the last 1 point, you still wont get any experience and
> the body will poof. Anytime the guard lands the killing blow your SOL.
>
> Mu
>
> -----Original Message-----
> From: Kris Christie [mailto:KChristie@...]
> Sent: Tuesday, April 17, 2001 1:59 PM
> To: 'EverQuest@yahoogroups.com'
> Subject: RE: [EverQuest] Question about other NPC's killing things.
>
>
> If you do more damage to the creature you will get the experience. But,
keep
> in mind if the creature has 500 hit points and you have done 251 points of
> damage to it and a guard comes along and hits for 350, you will not get
> experience for the kill.
>
> -----Original Message-----
> From: stonemn@... [mailto:stonemn@...]
> Sent: Tuesday, April 17, 2001 12:48 PM
> To: EverQuest@yahoogroups.com
> Subject: Re: [EverQuest] Question about other NPC's killing things.
>
>
>
> Well that kinda stinks, but I can see where it can be abused. What
happens
> if you do more than 50%, and strike the killing blow? I think it hangs
> around, but I can't remember if I've had that happen.
>
>
>
>
> <mackmillan@...> on 04/17/2001 10:54:14 AM
>
> Please respond to EverQuest@yahoogroups.com
>
> To: <EverQuest@yahoogroups.com>
> cc:
> Subject: Re: [EverQuest] Question about other NPC's killing things.
>
>
>
> When the guard kills it, you get not experience and the mob leaves no
> corpse. Its as if the guard had killed it from beginning to end, you
> doing over 50% damage doesn't matter. The reason for this is so people
> don't just go do alot of damage to mobs and then train them to the guards
> to finish the mob off.
>
>
> Mac
>
>
> On Tue, 17 Apr 2001 stonemn@... wrote:
>
> >
> > When you're fighting something, and you're so close to killing it, and a
> > guard or whatever comes along and deals the last blow, kills it, and it
> > vanishes....does that count like it killed it from beginning to end?
> > Doesn't it count if you do more than 50% of the damage to the critter?
> >
> >
>
>
>
